Argentina: Santiago del Estero founded by Francisco de Aguirre (some claim 1550)
Chile: Battle of Tucapel: Mapuches led by Lautaro defeat the Spanish at the ruins of Tucapel capturing Pedro de Valdivia who is then executed. A general Mapuche uprising develops under Lautaro.
China: The Ming capital Beijing was expanded to the south, increasing its size from 10 to 12 square kilometres (4 to  square miles).
Cuba: The Governor of Cuba relocates to Havana.
England: The Act Against Sectaries 1553 was issued.
Malta:
Charles V Mahdia offered to the Order of Saint John but the Order declined, so he ordered the destruction of the city.
Juan de Vega prohibited exportation of wheat to Malta so mills were built to prevent starvation.
